reviews.text: Stayed for a month at the end of 2009, small room rental with minimal kitchen. With electtric bill, was under US$800 (US$27/day). Free internet in room. Services provided proactivley as advertised, and promptly when requested. Seems to be more of a residence than a hotel, and English speaking staff not allways on hand, but they could not be more friendly or accomodating. Close enough to two Skytrain depots (consider a Pass for longer stays), and grocery outlets (found under department stores! Weird fact: if you enjoy cheeses, smuggle what you'll need into the country with you.)
reviews.title: Decent/Stylish/Competent - Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In BKK, even 3 star hotel would have satelite channels - here very few and the few channels that they have often don't work... Ground floor room has no natural sun light coming in that it is dark all day.... Internet keep logging off.... Over all, I don't recommend this place... there are many other choices in BKK... when I wanted to check out early, they refushed to refund money I already paid. Terrible. Staff speak very little English.
reviews.title: Don't recommend for long stay

reviews.text: This hotel is great for the money... it is in great location for easy commuting all around the city. The hotel is between two sky train stations which is great! You can walk a few blocks and be right near shopping, night market, food and transportation. This hotel is very basic... nothing luxurious about it. I like staying here because I am in BKK all the time and dont need the hotel staff to help me with anything. This hotel is great for a long stay or for someone who knows BKK and how to get around. If you are need to BKK I suggest staying a hotel that has english speaking or foreign speaking staff... I like this hotel because I am just there to shower and sleep... I dont need a pool or anything like that... If I want luxury I stay at the Anantara... when I just want a basic safe place to stay in BKK I stay here!
reviews.title: Great location... Inexpensive and good for long-term stay

reviews.text: We found the quiet, clean and comfortable place we were looking for at the Silom Convent garden. The room had a microwave, fridge and cutlery so we could prepare our own breakfast. In the 2 nights we were there I think we saw one other guest so it is indeed quiet. The staff don't speak great English but that is why we travel! It is next to the busy Silom area but off the main street and quiet.
reviews.title: Colourful place close to the action in a quiet corner.
